p: More recently, A. paniculata has been used to stimulate the immune system and treat myocardial ischemia [ 211]. A. paniculata inhibited interleukin (IL)-6, TNF-α mRNA, LPS-induced expression, and suppressed levels of TNF-α, IL-1β, JNK, C-reactive protein, and NF-κB [ 211]. Many labdane diterpenoids compounds have been found to act on the latter. The activation of the NF-κB pathway leads to several physiological responses, including inflammatory or innate immune response [ 217].
